body: What happens if I pass a `std::string` to this argument? It seems weird to templatize, but then for C++ types to not work. (This, btw, is why I have been somewhat reluctant to keep adding printf-style error sites; it's a loaded footgun.)
body_html: What happens if I pass a std::string to this argument? It seems weird to templatize, but then for C++ types to not work. (This, btw, is why I have been somewhat reluctant to keep adding printf-style error sites; it's a loaded footgun.)
